page.title: 13FORD CASTLE
page.content: FORD CASTLE There has been a castle since 1338,when William Heron was given permission to crenellate his dwelling in Ford.In 1385 the castle was taken by the Scots and held by them until the next year. Shortly before the battle of Flodden in 1513, the castle was taken by James IV of Scotland.The owner,William Heron,was being held prisoner in Scotland and the castle was severely damaged by the time the Scottish army left to take up its position for battle.In 1822 the Marquis of Waterford inherited the castle. During her years at Ford,Lady Waterford made many alterations and the castle to-day is largely the result of changes made at that time.
